thread.title: BRINK featured in Official Playstation Magazine

post.author: parsonsbear
post.body:
Hey mods- since this is an idTech4 game, should it get a forum under 'idTech4 powered'?

http://i581.photobucket.com/albums/ss255/warhawk_123/sc00079961.jpg
http://i581.photobucket.com/albums/ss255/warhawk_123/sc0007ff90.jpg
http://i581.photobucket.com/albums/ss255/warhawk_123/sc00081344.jpg

Looks pretty good- basically every news item I've seen on this game has a comment to the tune of 'i'm sick of all this concept art bullshit, lets see some screenshots!'

I liked ETQW a lot, seems like they're pulling out the vehicles and focusing on evolving the whole singleplayer/multiplayer blended experience. It's a wild idea, having the progression of objectives work as a multi-user experience with a complete storyline. I dunno, part of it sounds totally weird and ambitious, part of it sounds like a simple evolution of ET/ETQW.

Evidently, they got the main sound guy from 'BLACK' which is pretty cool. One of the main complaints about ETQW was the weak feeling weapons, but BLACK was punchy as hell.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AvnjqxDOTL4&feature=related

Rahdo of SD had a good comment about the whole 'designed for controllers' hubbub, which was basically- they've already nailed the Keyboard/Mouse thing, it just works and it's pretty easy to do that right. Controllers are way harder to nail a good 'feel' so they spend all their time trying to get that down.
